1: <sup>1</sup> Give ear, O my people, to my law: incline your ears to the words of my mouth.
2: <sup>2</sup> I will open my mouth in a parable: I will utter dark sayings of old:
3: <sup>3</sup> Which we have heard and known, and our fathers have told us.
4: <sup>4</sup> We will not hide them from their children, shewing to the generation to come the praises of the LORD, and his strength, and his wonderful works that he hath done.
5: <sup>5</sup> For he established a testimony in Jacob, and appointed a law in Israel, which he commanded our fathers, that they should make them known to their children:
6: <sup>6</sup> That the generation to come might know them, even the children which should be born; who should arise and declare them to their children:
7: <sup>7</sup> That they might set their hope in God, and not forget the works of God, but keep his commandments:
8: <sup>8</sup> And might not be as their fathers, a stubborn and rebellious generation; a generation that set not their heart aright, and whose spirit was not stedfast with God.
9: <sup>9</sup> The children of Ephraim, being armed, and carrying bows, turned back in the day of battle.
10: <sup>10</sup> They kept not the covenant of God, and refused to walk in his law;
11: <sup>11</sup> And forgat his works, and his wonders that he had shewed them.
12: <sup>12</sup> Marvellous things did he in the sight of their fathers, in the land of Egypt, in the field of Zoan.
13: <sup>13</sup> He divided the sea, and caused them to pass through; and he made the waters to stand as an heap.
14: <sup>14</sup> In the daytime also he led them with a cloud, and all the night with a light of fire.
15: <sup>15</sup> He clave the rocks in the wilderness, and gave them drink as out of the great depths.
16: <sup>16</sup> He brought streams also out of the rock, and caused waters to run down like rivers.
17: <sup>17</sup> And they sinned yet more against him by provoking the most High in the wilderness.
18: <sup>18</sup> And they tempted God in their heart by asking meat for their lust.
19: <sup>19</sup> Yea, they spake against God; they said, Can God furnish a table in the wilderness?
20: <sup>20</sup> Behold, he smote the rock, that the waters gushed out, and the streams overflowed; can he give bread also? can he provide flesh for his people?
21: <sup>21</sup> Therefore the LORD heard this, and was wroth: so a fire was kindled against Jacob, and anger also came up against Israel;
22: <sup>22</sup> Because they believed not in God, and trusted not in his salvation:
23: <sup>23</sup> Though he had commanded the clouds from above, and opened the doors of heaven,
24: <sup>24</sup> And had rained down manna upon them to eat, and had given them of the corn of heaven.
25: <sup>25</sup> Man did eat angels’ food: he sent them meat to the full.
26: <sup>26</sup> He caused an east wind to blow in the heaven: and by his power he brought in the south wind.
27: <sup>27</sup> He rained flesh also upon them as dust, and feathered fowls like as the sand of the sea:
28: <sup>28</sup> And he let it fall in the midst of their camp, round about their habitations.
29: <sup>29</sup> So they did eat, and were well filled: for he gave them their own desire;
30: <sup>30</sup> They were not estranged from their lust. But while their meat was yet in their mouths,
31: <sup>31</sup> The wrath of God came upon them, and slew the fattest of them, and smote down the chosen men of Israel.
32: <sup>32</sup> For all this they sinned still, and believed not for his wondrous works.
33: <sup>33</sup> Therefore their days did he consume in vanity, and their years in trouble.
34: <sup>34</sup> When he slew them, then they sought him: and they returned and enquired early after God.
35: <sup>35</sup> And they remembered that God was their rock, and the high God their redeemer.
36: <sup>36</sup> Nevertheless they did flatter him with their mouth, and they lied unto him with their tongues.
37: <sup>37</sup> For their heart was not right with him, neither were they stedfast in his covenant.
38: <sup>38</sup> But he, being full of compassion, forgave their iniquity, and destroyed them not: yea, many a time turned he his anger away, and did not stir up all his wrath.
39: <sup>39</sup> For he remembered that they were but flesh; a wind that passeth away, and cometh not again.
40: <sup>40</sup> How oft did they provoke him in the wilderness, and grieve him in the desert!
41: <sup>41</sup> Yea, they turned back and tempted God, and limited the Holy One of Israel.
42: <sup>42</sup> They remembered not his hand, nor the day when he delivered them from the enemy.
43: <sup>43</sup> How he had wrought his signs in Egypt, and his wonders in the field of Zoan.
44: <sup>44</sup> And had turned their rivers into blood; and their floods, that they could not drink.
45: <sup>45</sup> He sent divers sorts of flies among them, which devoured them; and frogs, which destroyed them.
46: <sup>46</sup> He gave also their increase unto the caterpiller, and their labour unto the locust.
47: <sup>47</sup> He destroyed their vines with hail, and their sycomore trees with frost.
48: <sup>48</sup> He gave up their cattle also to the hail, and their flocks to hot thunderbolts.
49: <sup>49</sup> He cast upon them the fierceness of his anger, wrath, and indignation, and trouble, by sending evil angels among them.
50: <sup>50</sup> He made a way to his anger; he spared not their soul from death, but gave their life over to the pestilence;
51: <sup>51</sup> And smote all the firstborn in Egypt; the chief of their strength in the tabernacles of Ham:
52: <sup>52</sup> But made his own people to go forth like sheep, and guided them in the wilderness like a flock.
53: <sup>53</sup> And he led them on safely, so that they feared not: but the sea overwhelmed their enemies.
54: <sup>54</sup> And he brought them to the border of his sanctuary, even to this mountain, which his right hand had purchased.
55: <sup>55</sup> He cast out the heathen also before them, and divided them an inheritance by line, and made the tribes of Israel to dwell in their tents.
56: <sup>56</sup> Yet they tempted and provoked the most high God, and kept not his testimonies:
57: <sup>57</sup> But turned back, and dealt unfaithfully like their fathers: they were turned aside like a deceitful bow.
58: <sup>58</sup> For they provoked him to anger with their high places, and moved him to jealousy with their graven images.
59: <sup>59</sup> When God heard this, he was wroth, and greatly abhorred Israel:
60: <sup>60</sup> So that he forsook the tabernacle of Shiloh, the tent which he placed among men;
61: <sup>61</sup> And delivered his strength into captivity, and his glory into the enemy’s hand.
62: <sup>62</sup> He gave his people over also unto the sword; and was wroth with his inheritance.
63: <sup>63</sup> The fire consumed their young men; and their maidens were not given to marriage.
64: <sup>64</sup> Their priests fell by the sword; and their widows made no lamentation.
65: <sup>65</sup> Then the LORD awaked as one out of sleep, and like a mighty man that shouteth by reason of wine.
66: <sup>66</sup> And he smote his enemies in the hinder parts: he put them to a perpetual reproach.
67: <sup>67</sup> Moreover he refused the tabernacle of Joseph, and chose not the tribe of Ephraim:
68: <sup>68</sup> But chose the tribe of Judah, the mount Zion which he loved.
69: <sup>69</sup> And he built his sanctuary like high palaces, like the earth which he hath established for ever.
70: <sup>70</sup> He chose David also his servant, and took him from the sheepfolds:
71: <sup>71</sup> From following the ewes great with young he brought him to feed Jacob his people, and Israel his inheritance.
72: <sup>72</sup> So he fed them according to the integrity of his heart; and guided them by the skilfulness of his hands.
